data.title: Pipeline Tool - CustomProcessor - Attributes ignored

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.title: Pipeline Tool - CustomProcessor - Nullables edition
Fix some compiler warnings
data.body: Helps out with #2433. Most of these were wrong references in comments and unused variables/parameters. I only built Windows and WindowsGL solutions. The bulk of the leftover warnings for those platforms are about a DrawIndexedPrimitives overload being obsolete in tests, but that overload is what we need to use for XNA and I didn't feel like #ifdeffing around all of them :p Then there's some warnings thrown in NVorbis and code generated by TinyPG that I didn't fix (about CLS-compliance), there's some about GraphicsDevice.BlendFactor missing which will be fixed by #5176. There are some warnings about variables not being assigned, but I left those in and some about variables not being used in tests, but I glanced over and it seemed like they were used for reflection tests.

data.title: Implement GraphicsDevice.BlendFactor
data.body: Fixes #5175. Details and discussion is in the issue. When handling this I noticed the `force` boolean and _last<RenderState> variables in GraphicsDevice.OpenGL. Do we need those? We already have dirty flags. Or do we have to apply state before the first call to ApplyChanges maybe?

data.title: Missing GraphicsDevice.BlendFactor
avoid the case where normalizing 0,0 results in NaN,NaN and instead default to 0,0
data.body: minor fix for Vector2.Normalize to avoid it returning NaN,NaN when passed 0,0

data.title: [DX] Calling ApplyChanges() in Game actor cause Exception
data.body:
Seen on W8.1 but probably also an issue on other Windows/DX. 

If we call graphics.ApplyChanges() inside the Game constructor it has no effect on XNA and MG 3.5. It was most likely ignored.
With the latest develop build we get an error later inside Initialize()
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException] = {System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80004005): Error HRESULT E_FAIL has been returned from a call to a COM component.}
message: "DCOMPOSITION_ERROR_WINDOW_ALREADY_COMPOSED\r\n"

data.title: Missing TextureCube.GetData(...) method
data.body: The `TextureCube.GetData(CubeMapFace cubeMapFace, int level, Nullable<Rectangle> rect, T[] data, int startIndex, int elementCount)` method is missing (ref: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb197085.aspx).

data.title: Can't create a Continuous Integration environment due to installer issues.
data.body:
There is no simple way, at least not one that I am aware of, to create a CI build for a UWP MonoGame project, for example.
The content pipeline requires a dependency to:
`<Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets" />`
which is fine on a developer machine, but the main issue is that MonoGame Installer(http://www.monogame.net/releases/v3.5.1/MonoGameSetup.exe) requires administrative credentials, and that's not allowed on a build machine that you don't have admin credentials, like VSTS's Hosted Build (https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/docs/build/admin/agents/hosted-pool).

There should be a way to easily install all MonoGame Content Pipeline dependencies locally, or something else.

It's really bad to not be able to use this kind of setup.

I already apologize if there is a way that I'm not aware of, but I tried several ways to do this and got into a dead end.

Maybe we can have a "portable" ContentPipeline, maybe like a zipfile with all dependencies to MGCB.exe distributed as easily as we have the MonoGameSetup.exe, on a static URL at monogame.net website.
Any ideas on how to provide such a setup would be appreciated.

data.title: Keys.LeftAlt not detected
data.body:
Hello,

I'm trying to catch an Alt+Enter to switch to fullscreen/windowed mode but I don't know why I have the feeling Monogame can't detect if the LeftAlt key is down. I'm using a Surface Pro 4.

I tried just this code to check this problem:

```
foreach(Keys key in Keyboard.GetState().GetPressedKeys())
{
    Debug.WriteLine(key);
}
```

But nothing appended for the left ALT. But if I press the AltGr key I have 2 lines:

```
LeftControl
LeftAlt
```

I'm using Monogame Universal version 3.5.1.1679.

Regards,
Stef

data.title: NuGet package for UWP should reference SharpDX dlls.
Throw ObjectDisposedException on disposed resources
data.body:
(https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/5164)
- Avoid a NullReferenceException on SpriteBatch.End() and throw a more
  descriptive exception when the effect passed into SpriteBatch.Begin()
  has been disposed.
- MediaPlayer gave no feedback and did not play a song when calling
  Play() with a disposed song.
- SoundEffectInstance has the same effect as MediaPlayer (no reaction,
  no sound playing)

There are most likely more places where this behavior is desired, these are the ones I came up with, it's a start.

data.title: Pipeline Tool Windows look
data.body:
@Linchy mentioned in a PR that the Pipeline Tool does not look as nice as it could because of inconsistent colors. I agree! :) It looks like the icons were scrapped together a bit and colors are quirky. I took a screenshot and added some remarks:

![pipelineaesthethics](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14875382/18421511/99e1c84c-788c-11e6-8890-359876565f12.png)

So IMO it's mostly the icons and the build indicators. Can't we use icons from the [Visual Studio Image Library](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35825) or other actual Windows icons (not sure about licensing but surely we should be able to use Windows icons)?

cc @cra0zy By the way, awesome job on the Linux version, it looks great! I also like the cogs with settings for the Build Output and Properties :) I think there are a bunch of open issues on the Pipeline Tool that you already fixed. I'll go through them in a while to see which can be closed.

data.title: Added support for loading Compressed Textures into a TextureCube
data.body:
OpenGL did not support this, as a result you would get a

```
NotImplemented
```

Exception. This commit adds support for loading compressed
textures into a texturecube.

data.title: Pipeline Tool does not ignore Shader Compiler Warnings
Disposed assets loaded through a ContentManager can never be reloaded
data.body:
When any resource (for example a `Texture2D` or `Effect`) is loaded through a `ContentManager` instance, is then `Dispose()`d explicitly at a later time, there is no way to load this resource through the same `ContentManager` instance again.

Example code:

```
var test = Content.Load<Texture2D>("test");
....
test.Dispose();
....
test = Content.Load<Texture2D>("test");
```

The texture resource _"test"_ in this example can never be loaded through the same `ContentManager` again because it has been disposed and the `ContentManager` keeps a record of all resources loaded which makes it return the same disposed resource instance.

I have tested this, and it works the same way with XNA, but I am wondering if this is intended behavior with disposed resources, because besides creating a new `ContentManager` instance, I don't see a way of loading a disposed resource at a later time.

And to do this, I need to keep a record of disposed resources per `ContentManager` myself to predict when I need a new `ContentManager` just to load a disposed resource.

My opinion on this is that when I call `Load<T>`, I do NOT expect it to return an already disposed resource, even if I disposed this resource earlier, as there is no way to remove this disposed resource instance from the internal `ContentManager` record.

data.title: No portability guidelines for PS4
data.body:
I haven't found a list of what namespaces are supported when using Monogame in PS4. I can't test my game in PS4 before we get the dev kit but I would like if possible to prepare for this, and find out which one of the System.\* facilities are available, I'm sure others are in the same predicament.

I know about the portable class library, but it seems to be a lot of trouble and I don't mind having different projects, all I really need to know is which libraries are available on PS4 to be prepared, my understanding is this involves a Xamarin compiler, true? Is this available anywhere? I didn't find any information about this in their public docs.

Also does this mean I have to buy Xamarin to use Monogame in the PS4?

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] General Fixes
data.body:
Stuff done:
- fixed propertygrid crash on Linux/Mac due to incorrect cast of an object
  - new Eto Forms dll changed some combobox stuff so that broke it
- fixed not being able to change property of multiple items (fixes #5160)
- fixed closing project not clearing propertygrid
- fixed right clicking an item on Windows not selecting the current item
- fixed propertygrid sizing for windows sometimes showing left/right scrollbar
- improved appearence of items in new item dialog, they now show extension of the template and an icon is no longer displayed
- improved toolbar, now all items are always visible, with showing/hiding items there was a chance for a misclick

data.title: Get added to Microsoft's game dev guide

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
So MS has a guide for game development on Windows 10  here:

 "Windows 10 game development guide"
 https://msdn.microsoft.com/windows/uwp/gaming/e2e

We need to see how we can get MonoGame included on there and what content we need for it.

data.title: Refactor TouchQueue/TouchPanelState and split per platforms.
data.body:
Move event queue inside TouchPanelState. `*GamePlatform` & `*GameWindow` are no longer involved to buffer/re-route events.

The code is split into partial classes for each platform.
TouchPanelState.Default.cs does not buffer events.
~~TouchPanelState.WP.cs is similar to TouchQueue.cs, uses Queue<<T>> instead of List<<T>>.~~
TouchPanelState.WinRT.cs uses the lock-free ConcurrentQueue<<T>>.

data.title: Windows Project Sizable Window Bugs
data.body:
If I have a sizable window for my Windows project, the Window.ClientSizeChange event is also triggered by the graphics.ApplyChanges and so leads to a stack over flow due to an eternal self calling loop. I am sure it's not supposed to do this.

I have a work around for this where I can do the ApplyChange in the Update call.

There is another issue around minimizing the window too, when it is minimized, then restored, the window is left in an odd state where just the title bar is displayed and I can't get the window back as it was prior to minimizing :(
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2579338/18257315/6c170148-73b9-11e6-96fa-468566227c54.png)

I am including a zip with a project example that also has my work around in it.

[WindwsSizeableWindowIssue.zip](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/files/455638/WindwsSizeableWindowIssue.zip)

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Pads and Fixes
data.body:
Changes:
- calling build automatically saves the project
- fix property grid not resizing properly on Linux
- fix property grid control cells not resizing when resizing propertygrid
- fix items not expanding in treeview
- added Pads
  - projectview, propertygrid and buildoutput controls are now pads
  - they each have their own settings, this will help with stuff like #4458
    - settings are just a simple context menu
  - property grid settings contain "sorting" (abc, group)
  - build output settings contain "filtering" and "auto scrolling"
  - main menu "Pads" just points to existing pads settings
  - removed fileter output toolbar item

![screenshot from 2016-09-05 18-14-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/18253410/c051e306-7394-11e6-8105-a0f23824b1f1.png)

Settings icon is from: https://www.iconfinder.com/icons/1167993/cog_cogwheel_configuration_options_parameters_properties_settings_icon#size=16 (it's free for commercial use)

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Reference Editor Improvements
data.body:
Stuff done:
- fix "Remove" button crashing the app
- changing references no longer requires a restart for changes to take effect
- you can press "Del" key in reference editor to remove a reference

data.title: Disposing Game disposes Master Voice for DirectX
data.body: When Game is disposed the master voice is also disposed and you no longer have access to the subvoices. XNA doesn't dispose the master voice when game is disposed. Trying to use a SFX after disposing game will work in XNA. This might matter when you want to use MG without using the Game class. Can we just drop the disposal here? I'm not sure how big a deal it is to leave it undisposed when the application exits. Does this really matter at all? I ran into this while testing and I mostly opened this issue because MG behaviour does not match XNA here.

data.title: Removing old wiki references
data.body: This PR just removes old references to the GitHub wiki which has been removed to avoid confusion by new users.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Better Property Grid
data.body:
Changes:
- single click to start cell editing
- bool cells now have a checkbox control associated with them instead of double clicking to change value
- if a cell is being edited you can click anywhere inside property grid to cancel editing it and it won't start another cell edit
